pageContext.claim: “You know, Hillary wanted to put windmills all over the place. Let's put up some windmills. ‘When the wind doesn't blow, just turn off the television, darling, please. No wind out today. There's no wind. Please turn off the television, quickly.’”
pageContext.analysis: Lack of wind can prevent turbines from generating energy, but nothing that power grids aren't equipped to handle. Currently, the produce accounted for eight percent of all U.S. energy.
